brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this research study is to learn if a new 7 day patch ECG recording monitor
      can serve the same purpose as standard monitoring systems.  The new 7day patch is
      significantly smaller and lighter than previous ECG recorders.

clinical_study.brief_title: BDx 7 Day ECG Patch: Electrode Adhesion Clinical Study

detailed_description.textblock:
The primary purpose of this research is to evaluate ECG signal quality of the BDx 7 day ECG
      Patch heart monitor after 7 full days of wear, establishing that the device is safe and
      effective to wear for up to 7 days.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  cardiac patient volunteers (5 male and 5 female)

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  skin rash or infection over the sternum

          -  Sternal incision within 3 months from the date of enrollment

study_pop.textblock: cardiac patients followed at the study site's location

clinical_study.official_title: BDx 7 Day ECG Patch: Electrode Adhesion Clinical Study

authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

primary_outcome.description: The study will evaluate adhesive performance/durability by evaluating the Signal Quality of ECG data on the subjects (5 men and 5 women) in accordance with the requirements of FDA's ECG Electrode Guidance (section 5.A.3)1 and the ANSI/AAMI EC-12 Disposable ECG electrode technical standard (sections 4.4 and 5.4)2.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Skin comfort or discomfort Device comfort Device stability and contact

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective
